intro: Piper manabinum, commonly known as the Manabí pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is valued for its aromatic properties and is used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some local cuisines.
